document.discussion_title: Teenager in hospital after alleged stabbing
document.topic_text: Subscribe Now Update: 6.30pm: POLICE and forensic officers are investigating after a 19-year-old was stabbed during a disturbance in Napier Street yesterday afternoon. The teen was taken to Mackay Base Hospital with a wound to his leg following the incident at South Mackay. A police spokesperson said they were called to the disturbance about 3.10pm allegedly involving four to five people. Neighbours claimed to have heard yelling and fighting from inside the house and on the driveway of the residence. Police CIB and Forensics officers were on scene at about 5pm investigating the incident, but were unable to comment. If you have any information that could assist police with their investigations, please phone Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000. Initial Story A TEENAGER has been taken to Mackay Base Hospital with a leg injury after being reportedly stabbed. A Queensland Ambulance Service spokesman said a 19-year-old male was transported in a stable condition at 3.15pm this afternoon from a South Mackay address. He could not comment on how the man sustained the injury. south mackay
